intro: Sticherus bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored sticherus, is a small, annual herbaceous plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, two-toned flowers that range from white to pink. Native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its unique floral structure and coloration make it a subject of interest in botanical studies.
